verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> again to me, saying, <S%H559><s%>
Now, you son <S%H1121><s%> of man, <S%H120><s%> take <S%H5375><s%> up a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for Tyrus; <S%H6865><s%>

And say <S%H559><s%> to Tyrus, <S%H6865><s%> O you that are situate <S%H3427><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> the entry <S%H3996><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> which are a merchant <S%H7402><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> for many <S%H7227><s%> isles, <S%H339><s%> Thus <S%H3541><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> GOD; <S%H3069><s%> O Tyrus, <S%H6865><s%> you have said, <S%H559><s%> I am of perfect <S%H3632><s%> beauty. <S%H3308><s%>
Your borders <S%H1366><s%> are in the middle <S%H3820><s%> of the seas, <S%H3220><s%> your builders <S%H1129><s%> have perfected <S%H3634><s%> your beauty. <S%H3308><s%>

They have made <S%H1129><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> your ship boards <S%H3871><s%> of fir <S%H1265><s%> trees of Senir: <S%H8149><s%> they have taken <S%H3947><s%> cedars <S%H730><s%> from Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> to make <S%H6213><s%> masts <S%H8650><s%> for you.

Of the oaks <S%H437><s%> of Bashan <S%H1316><s%> have they made <S%H6213><s%> your oars; <S%H4880><s%> the company <S%H1323><s%> of the Ashurites <S%H843><s%> have made <S%H6213><s%> your benches <S%H7175><s%> of ivory, <S%H8127><s%> brought out of the isles <S%H339><s%> of Chittim. <S%H3794><s%>

Fine linen <S%H8336><s%> with broidered <S%H7553><s%> work <S%H7553><s%> from Egypt <S%H4714><s%> was that which you spread <S%H4666><s%> forth to be your sail; <S%H5251><s%> blue <S%H8504><s%> and purple <S%H713><s%> from the isles <S%H339><s%> of Elishah <S%H473><s%> was that which covered <S%H4374><s%> you.

The inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Zidon <S%H6721><s%> and Arvad <S%H719><s%> were your mariners: <S%H7751><s%> your wise <S%H2450><s%> men, O Tyrus, <S%H6865><s%> that were in you, were your pilots. <S%H2259><s%>

The ancients <S%H2204><s%> of Gebal <S%H1381><s%> and the wise <S%H2450><s%> men thereof were in you your caulkers: <S%H2388><s%> <S%H919><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the ships <S%H591><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> with their mariners <S%H4419><s%> were in you to occupy <S%H6148><s%> your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>

They of Persia <S%H6539><s%> and of Lud <S%H3865><s%> and of Phut <S%H6316><s%> were in your army, <S%H2428><s%> your men <S%H582><s%> of war: <S%H4421><s%> they hanged <S%H8518><s%> the shield <S%H4043><s%> and helmet <S%H3553><s%> in you; they set <S%H5414><s%> forth your comeliness. <S%H1926><s%>

The men <S%H1121><s%> of Arvad <S%H719><s%> with your army <S%H2428><s%> were on your walls <S%H2346><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about, and the Gammadims <S%H1575><s%> were in your towers: <S%H4026><s%> they hanged <S%H8518><s%> their shields <S%H7982><s%> on your walls <S%H2346><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about; they have made <S%H6213><s%> your beauty <S%H3308><s%> perfect. <S%H3634><s%>

Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> was your merchant <S%H5503><s%> by reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> kind of riches; <S%H1952><s%> with silver, <S%H3701><s%> iron, <S%H1270><s%> tin, <S%H913><s%> and lead, <S%H5777><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> in your fairs. <S%H5801><s%>

Javan, <S%H3120><s%> Tubal, <S%H8422><s%> and Meshech, <S%H4902><s%> they were your merchants: <S%H7402><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> the persons <S%H5315><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> and vessels <S%H3627><s%> of brass <S%H5178><s%> in your market. <S%H4627><s%>
They of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Togarmah <S%H8425><s%> traded <S%H5414><s%> in your fairs <S%H5801><s%> with horses <S%H5483><s%> and horsemen <S%H6571><s%> and mules. <S%H6505><s%>

The men <S%H1121><s%> of Dedan <S%H1719><s%> were your merchants; <S%H7402><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> isles <S%H339><s%> were the merchandise <S%H5506><s%> of your hand: <S%H3027><s%> they brought <S%H7725><s%> you for a present <S%H814><s%> horns <S%H7161><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%> and ebony. <S%H1894><s%>

Syria <S%H758><s%> was your merchant <S%H5503><s%> by reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of the wares <S%H4639><s%> of your making: <S%H4639><s%> they occupied <S%H5414><s%> in your fairs <S%H5801><s%> with emeralds, <S%H5306><s%> purple, <S%H713><s%> and broidered <S%H7553><s%> work, <S%H7553><s%> and fine linen, <S%H948><s%> and coral, <S%H7215><s%> and agate. <S%H3539><s%>

Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and the land <S%H776><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> they were your merchants: <S%H7402><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> in your market <S%H4627><s%> wheat <S%H2406><s%> of Minnith, <S%H4511><s%> and Pannag, <S%H6436><s%> and honey, <S%H1706><s%> and oil, <S%H8081><s%> and balm. <S%H6875><s%>

Damascus <S%H1834><s%> was your merchant <S%H5503><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of the wares <S%H4639><s%> of your making, <S%H4639><s%> for the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> riches; <S%H1952><s%> in the wine <S%H3196><s%> of Helbon, <S%H2463><s%> and white <S%H6713><s%> wool. <S%H6785><s%>

Dan <S%H1835><s%> also and Javan <S%H3120><s%> going <S%H235><s%> to and fro <S%H235><s%> occupied <S%H5414><s%> in your fairs: <S%H5801><s%> bright <S%H6219><s%> iron, <S%H1270><s%> cassia, <S%H6916><s%> and calamus, <S%H7070><s%> were in your market. <S%H4627><s%>
Dedan <S%H1719><s%> was your merchant <S%H7402><s%> in precious <S%H2667><s%> clothes <S%H899><s%> for chariots. <S%H7396><s%>

Arabia, <S%H6152><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the princes <S%H5387><s%> of Kedar, <S%H6938><s%> they occupied <S%H5503><s%> with you in lambs, <S%H3733><s%> and rams, <S%H352><s%> and goats: <S%H6260><s%> in these were they your merchants. <S%H5503><s%>

The merchants <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%> and Raamah, <S%H7484><s%> they were your merchants: <S%H7402><s%> they occupied <S%H5414><s%> in your fairs <S%H5801><s%> with chief <S%H7218><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> spices, <S%H1314><s%> and with all <S%H3605><s%> precious <S%H3368><s%> stones, <S%H68><s%> and gold. <S%H2091><s%>

Haran, <S%H2771><s%> and Canneh, <S%H3656><s%> and Eden, <S%H5731><s%> the merchants <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba, <S%H7614><s%> Asshur, <S%H804><s%> and Chilmad, <S%H3638><s%> were your merchants. <S%H7402><s%>

These <S%H1992><s%> were your merchants <S%H7402><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> sorts <S%H4360><s%> of things, in blue <S%H8504><s%> clothes, <S%H1545><s%> and broidered <S%H7553><s%> work, <S%H7553><s%> and in chests <S%H1595><s%> of rich apparel, <S%H1264><s%> bound <S%H2280><s%> with cords, <S%H2256><s%> and made of cedar, <S%H729><s%> among your merchandise. <S%H4819><s%>

The ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> did sing <S%H7788><s%> of you in your market: <S%H4627><s%> and you were replenished, <S%H4390><s%> and made very <S%H3966><s%> glorious <S%H3519><s%> in the middle <S%H3820><s%> of the seas. <S%H3220><s%>

Your rowers <S%H7751><s%> have brought <S%H935><s%> you into great <S%H7227><s%> waters: <S%H4325><s%> the east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> has broken <S%H7665><s%> you in the middle <S%H3820><s%> of the seas. <S%H3220><s%>

Your riches, <S%H1952><s%> and your fairs, <S%H5801><s%> your merchandise, <S%H4627><s%> your mariners, <S%H4419><s%> and your pilots, <S%H2259><s%> your caulkers, <S%H2388><s%> <S%H919><s%> and the occupiers <S%H6148><s%> of your merchandise, <S%H4627><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> your men <S%H582><s%> of war, <S%H4421><s%> that are in you, and in all <S%H3605><s%> your company <S%H6951><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of you, shall fall <S%H5307><s%> into the middle <S%H3820><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of your ruin. <S%H4658><s%>
The suburbs <S%H4054><s%> shall shake <S%H7493><s%> at the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the cry <S%H2201><s%> of your pilots. <S%H2259><s%>

And all <S%H3605><s%> that handle <S%H8610><s%> the oar, <S%H4880><s%> the mariners, <S%H4419><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the pilots <S%H2259><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> shall come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> from their ships, <S%H591><s%> they shall stand <S%H5975><s%> on the land; <S%H776><s%>

And shall cause their voice <S%H6963><s%> to be heard <S%H8085><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you, and shall cry <S%H2199><s%> bitterly, <S%H4751><s%> and shall cast <S%H5927><s%> up dust <S%H6083><s%> on their heads, <S%H7218><s%> they shall wallow <S%H6428><s%> themselves in the ashes: <S%H665><s%>

And they shall make themselves utterly bald <S%H7139><s%> for you, and gird <S%H2296><s%> them with sackcloth, <S%H8242><s%> and they shall weep <S%H1058><s%> for you with bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of heart <S%H5315><s%> and bitter <S%H4751><s%> wailing. <S%H4553><s%>

And in their wailing <S%H5204><s%> they shall take <S%H5375><s%> up a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for you, and lament <S%H6969><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> you, saying, What <S%H4100><s%> city is like Tyrus, <S%H6865><s%> like the destroyed <S%H1822><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the sea? <S%H3220><s%>

When your wares <S%H5801><s%> went <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the seas, <S%H3220><s%> you filled <S%H7646><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> people; <S%H5971><s%> you did enrich <S%H6238><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your riches <S%H1952><s%> and of your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>

In the time <S%H6256><s%> when you shall be broken <S%H7665><s%> by the seas <S%H3220><s%> in the depths <S%H4615><s%> of the waters <S%H4325><s%> your merchandise <S%H4627><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> your company <S%H6951><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of you shall fall. <S%H5307><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the isles <S%H339><s%> shall be astonished <S%H8074><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> you, and their kings <S%H4428><s%> shall be sore <S%H8178><s%> afraid, <S%H8175><s%> they shall be troubled <S%H7481><s%> in their countenance. <S%H6440><s%>
The merchants <S%H5503><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%> shall hiss <S%H8319><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> you; you shall be a terror, <S%H1091><s%> and never <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5769><s%> shall be any more.
